page.title: 01PETWORTH FARMS AND PARKS
page.content: The area is predominately fairly heavy farmland, mixed with deciduous woods and some conifers. The S.W. corner of the grid is the N.E. part of Petworth Park, famous for its herd of Fallow Deer and flock of Black Sheep. The grid area contains 3 large fishing ponds and lakes. The A283 runs north to south through grid square number 1, 5 and 9. All the farmland is Leconfiel Estate owned, some tenanted, some farmed in hamd. Some of the oldest farmhouses are Limbo, Guntersbridge, Osiers and Palfrey which dates from 1327. Hunting, shooting and fishing is carried on over the whole area. The main employment is agriculture and estate forestry. There are a handful of privately owned houses in the area. the majority of the accommodation is attached to the Leonfield Estate.
